page.title: 01The Parish of Kimbolton
page.content: This block contains most of the parish of Kimbolton. At its centre lies the former market_town (present population 1100) nominated a conservation area of special interest because of its church, its castle and its collection of timber_framed houses. It is also{a Rural Service {Centre} and has grown steadily over the past 20 years, while retaining its compact medieval plan.{The A45 trunk {road to the East Coast ports at {present carries too much heavy traffic {for comfort.}Most of the block,though, is agricultural land surrounding this nucleus. There are 387 houses in the parish,333 of which are privately owned.21% of the population is under 16,17% are pensioners.81% of householders own cars (1981 census)
